intro: Sebastiania brasiliensis var. pallida, commonly known as the pale sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil, where it thrives in humid, tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and elliptical, leathery leaves. It is often found growing in shaded, moist environments within the understory of dense forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species and is of interest for conservation efforts.
